required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assisted Partner Services and HIVST in Western Kenya
clinical_study.official_title: Implementing Assisted Partner Services for HIV Testing and Treatment in Western Kenya

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock: This study includes different designs with Aim 1 being a cluster randomized controlled trial to investigate the use of HIV self-testing (HIVST) as a mode of HIV testing in Western Kenya in addition to the standard of care, assisted partner services (aPS). Aim 2 includes focus group discussions, in-depth interviews, semi-structured interviews, direct observation of facility infrastructure and clinic procedures, and data extraction from facility and county/national databases and expenditure reports to study acceptability, costs, and implementation aspects of HIVST within the aPS framework.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants testing for the first time
primary_outcome.description: Identify if there's a difference between standard aPS and aPS+HIVST in the number of participants choosing to get HIV tested for the first time.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of newly diagnosed HIV-infected or known positive and not in care
primary_outcome.description: Identify if there's a difference between standard aPS and aPS+HIVST in the number of participants newly being diagnosed with HIV after participation, or those known to be positive but not currently under care.

primary_outcome.measure: Linking a new positive or known positive not in care to a treatment center
primary_outcome.description: Identify if there's a difference between standard aPS and aPS+HIVST in the number of participants that are linked to care at a treatment center.

primary_outcome.measure: Initiating ART, or re-initiating ART if previously lost to follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Identify if there's a difference between standard aPS and aPS+HIVST in the number of participants that initiate (or re-initiate) ART.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difficulty of using the HIVST kit
secondary_outcome.description: Understand the ease of using HIV self-testing kits in this population and setting, via a survey question with a 4 point Likert scale ranging from "very easy" to "very "hard".

secondary_outcome.measure: Difficulty of interpreting the HIVST results
secondary_outcome.description: Understand the readability of HIV self-testing results in this population and setting, via a survey question.

arm_group.description: Subjects receive standard assisted partner services from their local HIV testing services (HTS) counselor.

Subjects receive standard assisted partner services from their local HIV testing services (HTS) counselor as well as the option to do HIV self-testing (HIVST) instead of testing at the local HTS location.

intervention.description: aPS will be offered to sexually active men and women who test HIV seropositive at the study sites by facility staff supported by aPS advisors. Those accepting aPS will be asked to provide names and contact information (phone numbers; home and work addresses) for their sexual partners, and these partners will be contacted, notified anonymously of the HIV exposure, and offered HIV self-testing by HTS counselors working at the facilities. Any partner who tests HIV seropositive will receive assistance linking to care and registering in an HIV comprehensive care clinic. They will also receive aPS so that their partners can be notified and HIV tested. Follow-up of index clients will continue after testing through HTS locations and all partners will be followed to determine HIV testing and treatment outcomes.

aPS will be offered to sexually active men and women who test HIV seropositive at the study sites by facility staff supported by aPS advisors. Those accepting aPS will be asked to provide names and contact information (phone numbers; home and work addresses) for their sexual partners, and these partners will be contacted, notified anonymously of the HIV exposure, and offered HIV testing at their local HTS location by HTS counselors working at the facilities. Any partner who tests HIV seropositive will receive assistance linking to care and registering in an HIV comprehensive care clinic. They will also receive aPS so that their partners can be notified and HIV tested. Follow-up of index clients will continue after testing through HTS locations and all partners will be followed to determine HIV testing and treatment outcomes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Aim 1:
- Men and women
- Tests HIV positive and is not in care or on treatment
- ≥18 years old
- Willing and able to provide informed consent
- Able to provide locator information for sexual partners
Aim 2:
- ≥18 years old
- Willing and able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
Aim 1:
- Pregnancy
- Reports intimate partner violence during last month
- <18 years old
Aim 2:
• <18 years old

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor, School of Medicine: Global Health
